column12: REPEATER CONFIGURATION FOR CHANNEL STATE INFORMATION REFERENCE SIGNAL
column13: Apparatuses, methods, and systems are disclosed for repeater configuration for channel state information reference signal. An apparatus (800) includes a transceiver (825) that receives a first configuration from a base station (121) of a mobile wireless communication network, the first configuration comprising channel state information reference signal ("CSI-RS") configuration information for amplifying and forwarding CSI-RS beams to a user equipment ("UE") device (700) from the apparatus (800). The transceiver (825) receives a second configuration from the base station (121), the second configuration comprising configuration information for performing measurement and reporting of the CSI-RS beams. The transceiver (825) receives repeater-specific CSI-RS to be forwarded to the UE device (700) and transmits the repeater-specific CSI-RS to the UE device (700) according to the first configuration.
column15: ALI ALI RAMADAN;;BHAMRI ANKIT;;HINDY AHMED;;CHEEMA SHER ALI;;NANGIA VIJAY

column12: REPEATER CONFIGURATION FOR CHANNEL STATE INFORMATION REFERENCE SIGNAL
column13: Apparatuses, methods, and systems are disclosed for repeater configuration for channel state information reference signal. An apparatus includes a transceiver that receives a first configuration from a base station of a mobile wireless communication network, the first configuration comprising channel state information reference signal (“CSI-RS”) configuration information for amplifying and forwarding CSI-RS beams to a user equipment (“UE”) device from the repeater node. The transceiver receives a second configuration from the base station, the second configuration comprising configuration information for performing measurement and reporting of the CSI-RS beams. The transceiver receives repeater-specific CSI-RS to be forwarded to the UE device and transmits the repeater-specific CSI-RS to the UE device according to the first configuration.
column15: ALI ALI RAMADAN;;BHAMRI ANKIT;;HINDY AHMED;;CHEEMA SHER ALI;;NANGIA VIJAY

column13: Apparatuses, methods, and systems are disclosed for repeater configuration for initial access. An apparatus includes a transceiver that that receives an initial setup configuration from a base station of a mobile wireless communication network for establishing a forwarding link with a user equipment (“UE”) device, receives an initial access configuration from the base station, the initial access configuration comprising one or more configuration parameters that allow the UE to establish access to the mobile wireless communication network, and transmits feedback to the base station that indicates reception of one or more of the initial setup configuration and the initial access configuration.
column15: ALI ALI RAMADAN;;BHAMRI ANKIT;;CHEEMA SHER ALI;;HINDY AHMED;;NANGIA VIJAY

column12: CSI reporting with indication of recommended subcarrier spacing value
column13: A user equipment, UE, receives a configuration of a CSI report, followed by a CSI-RS reference signal, from a network device, gNB. Thereafter, the UE performs channel measurements including one or more of Doppler spread, average delay, delay spread, phase noise power, and/or inter-carrier interference level; based on these measurements, the UE determines at least one recommended subcarrier spacing (SCS) value and explicitly or implicitly sends back the recommended SCS in the CSI report. The gNB receives the CSI report, checks a target demand, updates a previous SCS to a new SCS, and transmits a PDCCH to schedule a new PDSCH, where the PDCCH notifies the UE of the new SCS.
column15: BHAMRI ANKIT;;ALI AHMED R;;GANESAN KAVITHA;;NANGIA VIJAY;;CHEEMA SCOTT A

column12: Inserting beam switching gaps between beam transmissions
column13: Devices, methods, and systems for inserting beam switching gaps between beam transmissions are disclosed. An apparatus (900) includes a processor (905) that inserts gaps between consecutive transmissions from a mobile wireless communication network to a user equipment ("UE") device, the consecutive transmissions being scheduled on different beams. The apparatus (900) includes a transceiver (925) that indicates to the UE device a type of gap inserted between the consecutive transmissions scheduled on different beams and indicates to the UE device a number of null symbols used between the consecutive transmissions scheduled on different beams.
column15: ALI AHMED R;;BHAMRI ANKIT;;GANESAN KAVITHA;;CHEEMA SCOTT A;;NANGIA VIJAY

column13: Apparatuses, methods, and systems are disclosed for repeater configuration for initial access. An apparatus (1000) includes a transceiver (1025) that receives an initial setup configuration from a base station (121) of a mobile wireless communication network (115) for establishing a forwarding link with a user equipment ("UE") device (105), receives an initial access configuration from the base station (121), the initial access configuration comprising one or more configuration parameters that allow the UE (105) to establish access to the mobile wireless communication network (115), and transmits feedback to the base station (121) that indicates reception of one or more of the initial setup configuration and the initial access configuration.
column15: ALI ALI RAMADAN;;BHAMRI ANKIT;;CHEEMA SHER ALI;;HINDY AHMED;;NANGIA VIJAY

column13: The invention discloses a device, a method and a system for configuring a wake-up signal. A method (600) includes receiving (602), at a user equipment, a discontinuous reception configuration including a slot offset and/or a turn-on duration periodicity. The method (600) includes receiving (604) a wake-up signal configuration including a wake-up signal offset and/or a monitoring occasion. The wake-up signal configuration is received using scrambled downlink control information signaling. The method (600) includes receiving (606) information indicating that a sounding reference signal is transmitted in a sounding reference signal resource using a transmit beam and/or a transmit spatial filter during a discontinuous receive sleep period. The method (600) includes receiving (608) a control signal using a corresponding receive beam and/or receive spatial filter. The method (600) includes configuring (610) a spatial filter relationship between the sounding reference signal resource and wake-up signal reception using a downlink control information signal.
column15: GANESAN KAVITHA;;BHAMRI ANKIT;;NANGIA VIJAY;;ALI AHMED R;;CHEEMA SCOTT A;;BEN HAJ FREIJ AMEDEO
